title: ğŸŸ¢ Install with Wallyâ€‹
content: Wally is a package manager for Roblox that allows you to easily add dependencies to your projects. To use this package, follow these steps: 1. Install Wallyâ€‹ If you haven't already installed Wally, follow the installation instructions here. 2. Add the Package to wally.tomlâ€‹ Open your wally.toml file and add the following dependency: [dependencies] PackageName = "kinqandi/addy@0.0.1"

title: Step-by-Step Instructions:â€‹
content: Go to Rbx-Cloud: Navigate to our website to begin.Authenticate with Roblox: Log in using Roblox Oauth to link your projects.Add a Project: Once authenticated, click on "Add Project" to create your new project.Select Entity Owner: Choose the owner of the entity (either you or a group) (You must own the group/experience, and the experience must be public for it to be generated).Select Game: Pick the game you want to manage from the list of owned games.Submit: After selecting the game, hit "Submit" to proceed.Checkout the API:  IMPORTANT After submitting, you will see a authentication token. Copy this token, as it will be necessary for API access. WARNING ğŸš¨ Do not share this token with anyone! Keeping it private ensures your project remains secure.

title: ğŸ“¦ Installationâ€‹
content: You can install the Addy package either via Wally or directly from the Roblox Toolbox (Tutorial Here)

title: Creating an Instance of Addyâ€‹
content: To get started, create a new instance of the Addy class using your cloud configuration: local Addy = require(Packages.Addy) local cloudConfig = { universeId = 123456789, authToken = "your-auth-token", CloudConfigEnum = Addy.CloudConfigEnums.SerialIndex, MaxRetries = 3, RetryDelay = 5, } local addyInstance = Addy.new(cloudConfig)

title: Retrieving a Serial Numberâ€‹
content: You can retrieve a serial number for a unique ID using the GetSerial method: local uniqueId = "item12345" addyInstance:GetSerial(uniqueId):andThen(function(serialNumber) print("Serial number for " .. uniqueId .. ": " .. serialNumber) end):catch(function(error) warn("Failed to retrieve serial: " .. error) end)

title: Retrieving Multiple Serial Numbers (Bulk)â€‹
content: You can retrieve serial numbers for multiple unique IDs using GetBulkSerial: local uniqueIds = {"item12345", "item67890", "item111213"} addyInstance:GetBulkSerial(uniqueIds):andThen(function(serialNumbers) for i, serial in ipairs(serialNumbers) do print("Serial for " .. uniqueIds[i] .. ": " .. serial) end end):catch(function(error) warn("Failed to retrieve serials: " .. error) end)

title: Synchronous Retrieval (Optional)â€‹
content: If you prefer synchronous operations, you can use the GetSerialAsync and GetBulkSerialAsync methods: local serial = addyInstance:GetSerialAsync("item12345") print("Synchronous serial number: " .. (serial or "Failed")) local bulkSerials = addyInstance:GetBulkSerialAsync({"item12345", "item67890"}) print("Synchronous bulk serials: ", bulkSerials)

title: Cleanupâ€‹
content: Once you're done with the Addy instance, make sure to properly clean it up: addyInstance:Destroy()

title: CloudConfigEnumâ€‹
content: </> type CloudConfigEnum = number Represents a valid enum type for the cloud configuration.

title: CloudConfigâ€‹
content: </> type CloudConfig = { universeId:Â number, authToken:Â string, CloudConfigEnum:Â CloudConfigEnum, MaxRetries:Â number?, RetryDelay:Â number? } Contains the configuration for the cloud services.

title: CloudConfigEnumsâ€‹
content: </> Addy.CloudConfigEnums: {SerialNumber:Â 1} Table containing cloud configuration enums used for validation.

title: newâ€‹
content: </> Addy.new( cloudConfig:Â CloudConfig,-- The configuration details for the cloud. baseUrl:Â string?-- (Optional) The base URL of the cloud service. Defaults to "https://www.rbx-cloud.com/". ) â†’Â Addy-- A new instance of the Addy class. Usage Example local Addy = require(Packages.Addy) local cloudConfig = { universeId = 123456789, authToken = "your-auth-token", CloudConfigEnum = Addy.CloudConfigEnums.SerialIndex, MaxRetries = 3, RetryDelay = 5, } local addyInstance = Addy.new(cloudConfig)

title: GetSerialâ€‹
content: </> Addy:GetSerial( uniqueId:Â string,-- The unique identifier for which the serial is requested. dontIncrement:Â boolean?-- (Optional) If true, the serial number is not incremented. ) â†’Â Promise<number>-- A promise that resolves with the serial number. You can retrieve a serial number for a unique ID using the GetSerial method: Usage Example local uniqueId = "item12345" addyInstance:GetSerial(uniqueId):andThen(function(serialNumber) print("Serial number for " .. uniqueId .. ": " .. serialNumber) end):catch(function(error) warn("Failed to retrieve serial: " .. error) end)

title: GetBulkSerialâ€‹
content: </> Addy:GetBulkSerial( uniqueIds:Â {string}, dontIncrement:Â boolean?-- (Optional) If true, the serial numbers are not incremented. ) â†’Â Promise<{number}>-- A promise that resolves with a list of serial numbers. Retrieves serial numbers in bulk for multiple unique IDs from the cloud. You can retrieve serial numbers for multiple unique IDs using GetBulkSerial: local uniqueIds = {"item12345", "item67890", "item111213"} addyInstance:GetBulkSerial(uniqueIds):andThen(function(serialNumbers) for i, serial in ipairs(serialNumbers) do print("Serial for " .. uniqueIds[i] .. ": " .. serial) end end):catch(function(error) warn("Failed to retrieve serials: " .. error) end)

title: GetSerialAsyncâ€‹
content: </> Addy:GetSerialAsync( uniqueId:Â string,-- The unique identifier for which the serial is requested. dontIncrement:Â boolean?-- (Optional) If true, the serial number is not incremented. ) â†’Â number?-- The serial number, or nil if the operation fails. If you prefer synchronous operations, you can use the GetSerialAsync and GetBulkSerialAsync methods: local serial = addyInstance:GetSerialAsync("item12345") print("Synchronous serial number: " .. (serial or "Failed")) local bulkSerials = addyInstance:GetBulkSerialAsync({"item12345", "item67890"}) print("Synchronous bulk serials: ", bulkSerials)

title: GetBulkSerialAsyncâ€‹
content: </> Addy:GetBulkSerialAsync( uniqueIds:Â {string},-- A list of unique IDs for which the serials are requested. dontIncrement:Â boolean?-- (Optional) If true, the serial numbers are not incremented. ) â†’Â number?-- The serial numbers, or nil if the operation fails. Retrieves serial numbers in bulk for multiple unique IDs synchronously.

title: Destroyâ€‹
content: </> Addy:Destroy() â†’Â () Cleans up and destroys the Addy instance.
